featured.text: Despite their great 28 , however, most domesticated apples can be traced back to a common ancestor, the wild apple of Central Asia, Malus sieversii.
33 Paper lanterns and offerings are sent floating down rivers to accompany the ancestors back to their resting place.
Some people also visit the cemetery to clean up the family graves and pray for their ancestors.

definition.en_def: A person from whom one is descended, especially one more remote than a grandparent.
definition.example: My ancestors came from Europe many generations ago.
